verse:
यशः श्रियामेव परिश्रमः परो वर्णाश्रमाचारतपः श्रुतादिषु ।
अविस्मृतिः श्रीधरपादपद्मयोर्गुणानुवादश्रवणादरादिभिः ॥

terms.varṇa-āśrama-ācāra: by one’s execution of duties in the varṇāśrama system
terms.śrīdhara: of the maintainer of the goddess of fortune
terms.guṇa-anuvāda: of the chanting of the qualities

vedabase.translation: The great endeavor one undergoes in executing the ordinary social and religious duties of the varṇāśrama system, in performing austerities, and in hearing from the Vedas culminates only in the achievement of mundane fame and opulence. But by respecting and attentively hearing the recitation of the transcendental qualities of the Supreme Lord, the husband of the goddess of fortune, one can remember His lotus feet.

terms.वर्णाश्रमाचारतपः: Practice of duties according to one's caste and stage of life
terms.श्रुतादिषु: In the scriptural texts and others
terms.श्रीधरपादपद्मयोः: Of the lotus feet of Lord Shridhara (another name for Lord Vishnu)
terms.गुणानुवादश्रवणादरादिभिः: By hearing, reflecting and discussing about His qualities and deeds

bard.meaning: Effort for fame in beauty itself is supreme, along with non-forgetfulness ofcaste, stage of life, conduct, austerities, learning etc., and recitation,hearing, respect for the lotus feet of Śrīdhara, full of qualities.
